titleStmt.title: The long nos'd lass: or, The taylors, millers, tinkers, tanners, and glovers; with a great number of other trades-men, dash't out of countenance by a sow-ships beauty, to their great discontent, and her perpetual trouble. Tune of, The country farmer. This may be printed, R.P.

The long nos'd lass: or, The taylors, millers, tinkers, tanners, and glovers; with a great number of other trades-men, dash't out of countenance by a sow-ships beauty, to their great discontent, and her perpetual trouble. Tune of, The country farmer. This may be printed, R.P.

notesStmt.note: Verse : "[...] you not hear of a rumor of late ..."
Imperfect: trimmed and tightly bound affecting legibility.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
